oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Elizabeth MB Church Lodge: side view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Elizabeth Missionary Baptist Church, Lodge, and Cemetery

Color photograph of a two story weathered wood building, built on stone piers, with a red gable tin roof; left facade has a white door and one window on the first floor, and two boarded windows of the second floor; the right facade has a one white door on the first floor and two boarded windows on the second floor.

This historic congregation and meeting place dates to the spring of 1865 when Josiah Murray, a local landowner, gave lands to his emancipated slaves for a church and cemetery. The present church building dates to the late 20th century but the historic lodge/school dates to the late 19th-early 20th century.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American schools -- Tennessee;
Sheds
